name: Oakley Hall Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very welcoming, all staff were attentive and polite. The room was better than expected with little details that made you feel welcome such as milk in the fridge rather than the long life pots and home made biscuits to eat with a cup of tea.
reviews.title: HarIpsUK

reviews.text: Due to the cold weather we needed coats to get from the room to the restaurant but in the summer the strole would be lovely.
reviews.title: excellent place for business stays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For us it was was a pleasant relaxing stay and we would return.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stay in Basingstoke a lot due to it being the location of my work head office. I have stayed in a number of hotels in Basingstoke and found them largely to be very expensive, quite shabby or with other shortcomings. Oakley Hall is definitely the best I've found, and in a lovely big old manor house with vast grounds. The rooms are lovely, particularly the suites of which some are huge. I love the chocs and biscuits, robe and slippers (may be to do with our corporate rate!) and the food is generally excellent. The route in to Viables is 10mins which is less by far than other hotels considerably closer due to traffic routes. The only downside is that the wireless appears patchy in some of the rooms, and the forces chinook helicopter path is right overhead. Also, no pool or health club type facilities, but I just use David Lloyd anyway. Otherwise very good, and I will be staying again... probably numerous times.
reviews.title: Not very practical

reviews.text: We booked this overnighter with friends and were impressed from the minute we walked in the door.We booked the Gourmet champagne break and to be honest for the price we paid we werent expecting much. The staff are very friendly and efficient and the rooms were amazing! Very large and comfortable. We booked a standard room and our friends had an executive but in my opinion there wasnt much of a difference... dont pay for the upgrade... the basic rooms are brilliant.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.text: Stayed for dinner bed and breakfast in a courtyard room to celebrate friends 50th birthdays. Clean, modern, and well appointed, with White Company toiletries, and half bottle of champage, but room and particulalrly bathroom rather small. We are on the small side so just about fitted into the bed, but another couple who are around 6ft tall found their feet having over the edge. Food and service were very good, but again, portions on the small side.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a courtyard room. It was excellent. Large room, lovely decor. Very comfortable and relaxing. There was half a bottle of Champagne awaiting us when we arrived. We had afternoon tea in the beautiful appointed library. All food and drink was first class, including service. Staff were pleasant and helpful, especially Jonathan on reception - I left my necklace behind by mistake and when I phoned he went over to the room and found it for me and is posting it out by first class post. The grounds of the hotel are extensive and impressive - enjoyed a walk through the wooded grounds. I would recommend a stay here and would go back again.
reviews.title: A lovely birthday present

reviews.text: Had a lovely night away at Oakley hall we went on a deal, room was nice, well equipped bathroom was a little dissapointing, with its shower over the bath that was so high needed a ladder to climb in wouldn't have been good for the older guest, i hurt myself twice climbing out. great rainfall shower head but smaller one broken. Food was AMAZING dinner was great & a good selection for breakfast actually I think the nicest breakfast I've ever had at a hotel
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great food
Lovely stay
reviews.text: We stayed in a suite overlooking the courtyard, and had a great time. All the staff we came across were helpful, friendly and professional. The room was spotless and well equipped, and the grounds bbeautiful. We had a very nice tea on the terrace and the food was also very good. I would recommend staying here without hesitation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night on the 3rd May for our anniversary weekend.
reviews.title: beautiful setting, great staff and lovely food

reviews.text: Had a really good two night stay at Oakley Hall earlier this month. I picked it to give my mother a treat, she is rather elderly (90 next year) but enjoys good things! I wanted a walk-in shower, a large bedroom which was easily accessible. Their Courtyard Bedrooms were perfect, very large rooms with a large walk-in shower, full size bath, twin sinks and underfloor heating. We chose their 7 course tasting menu the first night and the a la carte the second - both meals were very enjoyable - not too twee on the plate but very well presented with delicious flavours. Although I would add it was about time they changed their "Winter Menu" to Spring! (Perhaps they were reflecting the recent weather!) The Courtyard Bedrooms are a little walk from the main house, where you have dinner and breakfast but the staff were very attentive and we had a golf buggy ride each way! I cannot fault their service, even room service away from the main house was very prompt. Will go again with my other half next time. Beautiful grounds.
reviews.title: Early April stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Oakley Hall for one night on their "gourmet & champagne getaway" deal for a birthday treat for my partner.
reviews.title: Gourmet and Champagne break-13th April 2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely Courtyard room with an extremely comfy queen sized bed, with touching extras including fruit, fresh milk and bottled water - and a half bottle of champagne.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel with attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tea, coffee and toiletries. The bathroom was fantatstic with a huge shower and the bedroom had a large flat screen tv, complete with blue ray player.
reviews.title: Warm welcome on a wet spring day

reviews.text: The 5 course tasting menu was exquisite and we can not praise the staff enough for their amazing service and attentiveness. They really made us feel special which would definatley make us want to return again in the future. Room service was fab too ...and the hotel do the most fabulous fresh smoked salmon baguettes with olives and tiny little curly crisps-not to mention the Long Island Iced tea cocktail-very strong but great!
reviews.title: Wedding Venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I booked a last minute break and Oakley Hall Hotel was wonderful and the staff catered to our every need. I have dietary requirements and the staff were more than happy to alter the menu to meet my needs.
reviews.title: What a fantastic find!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The courtyard room was beautiful, very spacious and clean and we were able to park our car right outside the door. The rooms are separate to the hotel so you don't hear any noise, just the noise of birds!
reviews.title: Wonderful!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A truly relaxing one night away - thank you for a wonderful time
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a two night stay here in April and stayed in a Courtyard Suite, it was wonderful. It is set in a superb location away from all the hustle and bustle the only noise was that of wildlife. The suite was immaculate and maid service exceptional. Breakfast was lovely, ordered full English and it could have fed two, didn't need to eat again till tea time. Would recommend this hotel and would return again. Thankyou for a lovely stay x
reviews.title: Good value romantic break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night on the 'Gourmet & Champagne' deal. We stayed in a courtyard room which was lovely, actually one of the nicest hotel rooms I've stayed in. We had afternoon tea outside, then went for a walk around the grounds. We later had dinner from the 5 course tasting menu which I couldn't fault, everything was tasty & service very good. Overall a fantastic hotel, no problems at all, we loved it & definately plan to return in the near future.
reviews.title: Dinner and champagne break 19th April 2013

description: Oakley Hall has now been beautifully restored to its former self. Offering a perfect setting for weddings, conferences, team building and corporate events. Now with 18 luxurious bedrooms and one three-bedroom cottage Oakley Hall is one of the finest venues in Hampshire for your country retreat.
